ExternalData.Titlesect: International Convention on Arrest of Ships, 1999

EIF.Label: Entry into force
EIF.Labeltext: 14 September 2011, in accordance with article 14(1)which reads as follows: "1. This Convention shall enter into force six months following the date on which 10 States have expressed their consent to be bound by it.".

TreatyText.Label: Text
TreatyText.Text: United Nations,Treaty Series, vol. 2797, p. 3; Doc. A/CONF.188.6; C.N.112.2011.TREATIES-2 of 14 March 2011 (Entry into force).

TreatyNote.Text: The Convention was adopted on 12 March 1999 at the United Nations/International Maritime Organization Diplomatic Conference on Arrest of Ships held in Geneva from 1 to 12 March 1999. In accordance with its article 12?1), the Convention will be open for signature by any State at United Nations Headquarters in New York from 1 September 1999 to 31 August 2000.
